meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>heaps</kanji>, so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to heap up</vocabulary>. It can also mean <vocabulary>to serve food</vocabulary>, as in you're heaping on food onto someone's plate.
readingMnemonic: Please keep heaping up the food. I want <reading>more</reading> (もる), more, more.
